table.name: mstr_contacts
table.remarks:
Represents a single method of contact for a person, entity, place, or other contextually relevant association.
**General Usage**
Note that there is a weakness in this part of the schema design in that contact information doesn't make sense outside of assignment to a person, facility, or entity, but such assignment is indirect through role assignments. This means it is conceivable that records in this table could become orphaned. At this stage, however, it doesn't seem worth it to denormalize the data to record the direct association.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: internal_name
column.remarks:
A candidate key useful for programmatic references to individual records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks:
A friendly name and candidate key for the record, suitable for use in user interactions
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks:
Indicates the entity which is the owner or "controlling".
**General Usage**
There are a couple of ways this can be used. The first case is illustrated by the example of a managed entity and an staffing entity that is an individual. The owning entity in this case will be the managed entity for contacts such as the details of the person's office address, phone, and email addresses that is used in carrying out their duties as staff. The second case is where the entity is in a selling, purchasing, or banking relationship with the managed entity. In this case the owning entity is the entity with which the managed entity has a relationship since a customer, vendor, or bank determines their own contact details.

column.name: external_name
column.remarks: A non-unique/non-key value used to display to users and external parties where uniqueness is less of a concern than specific end user presentation.

column.name: contact_type_id
column.remarks: Indicates the type of the contact record. Contact records store inforamtion of varying types such as phone numbers, physical addresses, email addresses, etc. The value in this column establishes which kind of contact data is being stored and indicates the data processing rules to apply.

column.name: contact_state_id
column.remarks: Establishes the current life-cycle state of the contact record, such as whether the record is active or not.

column.name: contact_data
column.remarks: Contains the actual contact data being stored by the record as well as associated metadata such as specialized data fields, mapping of the specialized fields to standard representation for data maintenance, display, printing, and integration.

column.name: contact_notes
column.remarks: Optional user provided notes related to the Contact record.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created
column.remarks:
The database role which created the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_timestamp_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which modified the record started. This field will be the same as diag_timestamp_created for inserted records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_wallclock_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time at the moment the record was actually modified. For long running transactions this time may be significantly later than the value of diag_timestamp_modified.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_modified
column.remarks:
The database role which modified the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_row_version
column.remarks:
The current version of the row. The value here indicates how many actual data changes have been made to the row. If an update of the row leaves all data fields the same, disregarding the updates to the diag_* columns, the row version is not updated, nor are any updates made to the other diag_* columns other than diag_update_count.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.
**Direct Usage**
This column is frequently used by by application logic to resolve the "dirty write" issues which can arise from concurrent data changes. As such any administrative override of automatic system maintenance of this value should consider the ramifications on application function.

column.name: diag_update_count
column.remarks:
Records the number of times the record has been updated regardless as to if the update actually changed any data. In this way needless or redundant record updates can be found. This row starts at 0 and therefore may be the same as the diag_row_version - 1.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_countries
table.remarks:
A listing of countries including currency symbology, official names, and other information concerning the country from standards bodies and international organizations.
**General Usage**
The table structure as it now stands is based on the data available at: https://datahub.io/core/country-codes

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: internal_name
column.remarks:
A candidate key useful for programmatic references to individual records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks:
A friendly name and candidate key for the record, suitable for use in user interactions
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: external_name
column.remarks: A non-unique/non-key value used to display to users and external parties where uniqueness is less of a concern than specific end user presentation.

column.name: official_name_ar
column.remarks: Country or Area official Arabic short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: official_name_cn
column.remarks: Country or Area official Chinese short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: official_name_en
column.remarks: Country or Area official English short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: official_name_es
column.remarks: Country or Area official Spanish short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: official_name_fr
column.remarks: Country or Area official French short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: official_name_ru
column.remarks: Country or Area official Russian short name from UN Statistics Division

column.name: iso3166_1_alpha_2
column.remarks: Alpha-2 codes from ISO 3166-1

column.name: iso3166_1_alpha_3
column.remarks: Alpha-3 codes from ISO 3166-1 (synonymous with World Bank Codes)

column.name: iso3166_1_numeric
column.remarks: Numeric codes from ISO 3166-1

column.name: iso4217_currency_alphabetic_code
column.remarks: ISO 4217 currency alphabetic code

column.name: iso4217_currency_country_name
column.remarks: (ISO4217-currency_country_name) :: ISO 4217 country name

column.name: iso4217_currency_minor_unit
column.remarks: (ISO4217-currency_minor_unit) :: ISO 4217 currency number of minor units

column.name: iso4217_currency_name
column.remarks: (ISO4217-currency_name) :: ISO 4217 currency name

column.name: iso4217_currency_numeric_code
column.remarks: (ISO4217-currency_numeric_code) :: ISO 4217 currency numeric code

column.name: cldr_display_name
column.remarks: (CLDR display name) :: Country's customary English short name (CLDR)

column.name: capital
column.remarks: Capital city from Geonames

column.name: continent
column.remarks: (Continent) :: Continent from Geonames

column.name: ds
column.remarks: (DS) :: Distinguishing signs of vehicles in international traffic

column.name: dial
column.remarks: Country code from ITU-T recommendation E.164, sometimes followed by area code

column.name: edgar
column.remarks: (EDGAR) :: EDGAR country code from SEC

column.name: fips
column.remarks: (FIPS) :: Codes from the U.S. standard FIPS PUB 10-4

column.name: gaul
column.remarks: (GAUL) :: Global Administrative Unit Layers from the Food and Agriculture Organization

column.name: geoname_id
column.remarks: (Geoname ID) :: Geoname ID

column.name: global_code
column.remarks: (Global Code) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: global_name
column.remarks: (Global Name) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: ioc
column.remarks: (IOC) :: Codes assigned by the International Olympics Committee

column.name: itu
column.remarks: (ITU) :: Codes assigned by the International Telecommunications Union

column.name: intermediate_region_code
column.remarks: (Intermediate Region Code) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: intermediate_region_name
column.remarks: (Intermediate Region Name) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: languages
column.remarks: (Languages) :: Languages from Geonames

column.name: marc
column.remarks: (MARC) :: MAchine-Readable Cataloging codes from the Library of Congress

column.name: region_code
column.remarks: (Region Code) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: region_name
column.remarks: (Region Name) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: sub_region_code
column.remarks: (Sub-region Code) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: sub_region_name
column.remarks: (Sub-region Name) :: Country classification from United Nations Statistics Division

column.name: tld
column.remarks: (TLD) :: Top level domain from Geonames

column.name: wmo
column.remarks: (WMO) :: Country abbreviations by the World Meteorological Organization

column.name: is_independent
column.remarks: (is_independent) :: Country status, based on the CIA World Factbook

table.name: mstr_country_address_format_assocs
table.remarks: Establishes relationships between address format records and country records and allows recognizing an address format as the default format for the country.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: country_id
column.remarks: Identifies the country with with the address format is being associated.

column.name: address_format_id
column.remarks: Identifies the address format which is to be associated with the country.

column.name: is_default_for_country
column.remarks: If true, this format should be used as the default format for the country. There should only ever be one default for any one country_id.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:

table.name: mstr_entities
table.remarks:
Master list of legal entities with whom the business interacts.
All legal entities are represented by this table, including the business using this application itself.
**General Usage**
The information stored in this record represents general information about the entity that is broadly applicable in all contexts which might use the entity.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks:
Indicates which managing entity is the owning entity for purposes of default visibility and usage limitations.
**General Usage**
The limited cases are primarily evident in searches and lists.
Explicit assignment of rights to entities, persons, facilities, etc. that are not the owning entity is still possible and those rights will prevail over the default access rules for non-owning entities.
There is a special case of owning entity where an entity is self owning. There may only be a single entity that is self owning and that, by definition, establishes that entity as the 'global entity'. The global entity has global administrative rights as well as allows access to those persons, facilities, and entities that it owns effectively making them global to all other managed entities. The global entity may be an actual business entity which essentially owns the MSBMS Instance or it may a purely administrative construct for managing the system.

column.name: internal_name
column.remarks:
A candidate key useful for programmatic references to individual records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks:
A friendly name and candidate key for the record, suitable for use in user interactions
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: external_name
column.remarks: A non-unique/non-key value used to display to users and external parties where uniqueness is less of a concern than specific end user presentation.

column.name: entity_type_id
column.remarks:
Defines the kind of entity that is being represented by the record and by extension the kinds of uses in which the entity may be used.
**General Usage**
Application functionality is determined in part by the configuration of the selected type.

column.name: entity_state_id
column.remarks:
Establishes current state of the entity in the established lifecycle of entity records.
**General Usage**
Certain application features and behaviors will depend on the configuration of the state value selected for a entity record.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created
column.remarks:

**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_entity_bank_entities
table.remarks:
Establishes an financial service provider relationship between an Owning entity and an Entity which provides financial and banking services.
**General Usage**
Banks can process certain financial related transactions and be associated with specific asset and liability accounts is relation to the owning Entity.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: Identifies an Entity which acts as a bank or financial institution in the relationship.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks: Identifies the Entity on whose behalf the banking relationship exists.

column.remarks:

**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_modified
column.remarks:
The database role which modified the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_row_version
column.remarks:
The current version of the row. The value here indicates how many actual data changes have been made to the row. If an update of the row leaves all data fields the same, disregarding the updates to the diag_* columns, the row version is not updated, nor are any updates made to the other diag_* columns other than diag_update_count.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.
**Direct Usage**
This column is frequently used by by application logic to resolve the "dirty write" issues which can arise from concurrent data changes. As such any administrative override of automatic system maintenance of this value should consider the ramifications on application function.

column.name: diag_update_count
column.remarks:
Records the number of times the record has been updated regardless as to if the update actually changed any data. In this way needless or redundant record updates can be found. This row starts at 0 and therefore may be the same as the diag_row_version - 1.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_entity_inventory_places
table.remarks: Establishes one or more Inventory Relationships between an Owning Entity and a Place.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: place_id
column.remarks: Identifies the place that will have an Inventory Relationship with the Owning Entity.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks: Establishes the Entity which has an Inventory Relationship to the identified place.

column.name: receives_external_inventory
column.remarks: If true, this inventory may receive inventory shipments from third parties such as might originate from purchase order transactions. If false, this inventory may not receive inventory from external third parties.

column.name: fulfills_external_inventory
column.remarks: If true, inventory units may be fulfilled from this place, for this entity. If false, this inventory may not participate as a source of fulfillment to third parties.

column.name: receives_internal_inventory
column.remarks: If true, inventory units may be received into this inventory from other inventories managed by the system. If false, other managed inventories will not be valid sources to replenish stocks in this inventory. Transferred inventory would be an example of a transaction requiring the inventory to allow the processing of internal receipts.

column.name: fulfills_internal_inventory
column.remarks: If true, inventory units may be fulfilled from this managed inventory to another inventory managed by the system. If false, the inventory may not serve as the source of inventory units to other managed inventories. Transferring inventory out is an example of a transaction requiring this internal fulfillment ability.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created
column.remarks:
The database role which created the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_timestamp_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which modified the record started. This field will be the same as diag_timestamp_created for inserted records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_wallclock_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time at the moment the record was actually modified. For long running transactions this time may be significantly later than the value of diag_timestamp_modified.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_modified
column.remarks:
The database role which modified the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_row_version
column.remarks:
The current version of the row. The value here indicates how many actual data changes have been made to the row. If an update of the row leaves all data fields the same, disregarding the updates to the diag_* columns, the row version is not updated, nor are any updates made to the other diag_* columns other than diag_update_count.

**Direct Usage**
This column is frequently used by by application logic to resolve the "dirty write" issues which can arise from concurrent data changes. As such any administrative override of automatic system maintenance of this value should consider the ramifications on application function.

column.name: diag_update_count
column.remarks:
Records the number of times the record has been updated regardless as to if the update actually changed any data. In this way needless or redundant record updates can be found. This row starts at 0 and therefore may be the same as the diag_row_version - 1.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_entity_person_roles
table.remarks:
Establishes the relationship between individual persons and and entity.
**General Usage**
Note that for now a simple table with the Entity, Person, and the Role assigned is sufficient for expressing the relationship, though in future it may be appropriate to have specific relationship tables like Entity/Entity relationships should the relationships not be containable in a single attribute describing the Role.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: The Person that is being assigned a Role with the Entity.

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: The Entity with which the identified Person has a Role. In many regards, this field identifies the Owner of the record.

column.name: entity_person_role_id
column.remarks: Identifies the Role being assigned to the Person for the identified Entity.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created

**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_entity_purchasing_entities
table.remarks:
Establishes a vendor relationship between an Owning Entity and its vendor Entity.
**General Usage**
This record, or its children, will define purchasing behavior when the transaction entity is the owning entity.

column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: Identifies the Entity which is the "vendor" in the relationship.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks: Identifies the Entity that will purchase goods and services from the vendor Entity.

table.remarks:

**General Usage**

table.name: mstr_entity_staff_entities

table.name: mstr_person_contact_roles
table.remarks: Establishes the Roles that Contact records serve in relation to the given Person.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Identifies the Person which has the relationship to the Contact information.

column.name: person_contact_role_id
column.remarks: Indicates a specific use or purpose for the identified Contact information.

column.name: place_id
column.remarks:
This is an optional value indicating whether the given Contact information is associated with a known Place.
**General Usage**
If the Contact information is associated with a specific Place, a reference to the Place record ID will appear here. Otherwise the value will be `NULL`.

column.name: contact_id
column.remarks: A reference to the Contact record which serves the given Role for the given Person.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created

**Direct Usage**

column.name: diag_update_count
column.remarks:
Records the number of times the record has been updated regardless as to if the update actually changed any data. In this way needless or redundant record updates can be found. This row starts at 0 and therefore may be the same as the diag_row_version - 1.
**General Usage**

table.name: mstr_persons
table.remarks: A Person is someone who acts as an agent on behalf of an Entity. This may be a real individual person in the world or indicate a function, such as “Customer Support”, where the actual person contacted may vary and identifying a specific individual is unimportant.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: internal_name
column.remarks:
A candidate key useful for programmatic references to individual records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks:
A friendly name and candidate key for the record, suitable for use in user interactions
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: external_name
column.remarks: A non-unique/non-key value used to display to users and external parties where uniqueness is less of a concern than specific end user presentation.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks:
Indicates which Managing Entity owns the Person record for the purposes of default visibility and access.
**General Usage**
Any Person record owned by the Global Entity is by default visible and usable by any Managed Entity.

column.name: formatted_name
column.remarks: Contains a jsonb object describing the naming fields, field layout, and the actual values of the user's name. Note that the format will normally have originated from the `ms_appl_data.syst_name_formats` table, but reflects the name formatting configuration at the time of capture.

column.name: person_type_id
column.remarks: The "kind" of Person being represented by the record. Specifically if the record represents an actual individual person or a function such as "clerk".

column.name: person_state_id
column.remarks: Indicates in which Person life-cycle state the record current sits. This can include designating the record as active or inactive.

column.name: access_account_id
column.remarks:
An optional association with a global Access Account, used for authentication to the application by users.
**Constraint Reference**
An Access Account can only be associated with a single Person record and as such must be unique in this table.
The reference to the `ms_syst_data.syst_access_accounts` table is a cross-database reference and therefore cannot be enforced using conventional database referential integrity constraints. The application developer, therefore, is responsible for ensuring that values in this table actually match valid `ms_syst_data.syst_access_accounts` records.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which created the record started.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_role_created
column.remarks:
The database role which created the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_timestamp_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time when the transaction which modified the record started. This field will be the same as diag_timestamp_created for inserted records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: diag_wallclock_modified
column.remarks:
The database server date/time at the moment the record was actually modified. For long running transactions this time may be significantly later than the value of diag_timestamp_modified.
**General Usage**

column.name: diag_role_modified
column.remarks:
The database role which modified the record.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.remarks:

If an update of the row leaves all data fields the same, disregarding the updates to the diag_* columns, the row version is not updated, nor are any updates made to the other diag_* columns other than diag_update_count.
**General Usage**

**Direct Usage**
This column is frequently used by by application logic to resolve the "dirty write" issues which can arise from concurrent data changes. As such any administrative override of automatic system maintenance of this value should consider the ramifications on application function.

column.name: diag_update_count
column.remarks:
Records the number of times the record has been updated regardless as to if the update actually changed any data. In this way needless or redundant record updates can be found. This row starts at 0 and therefore may be the same as the diag_row_version - 1.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

table.name: mstr_places
table.remarks: Places are the retail stores, warehouses, factories, and offices in which businesses conduct their operations. This is not synonymous with "address" as a place may have multiple, different addresses for different purposes.

column.name: id
column.remarks:
The record's primary key. The definitive identifier of the record in the system.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: owning_entity_id
column.remarks:
Indicates which Managing Entity owns the Place record for the purposes of default visibility and access.
**General Usage**
Any Place record owned by the Global Entity is by default visible and usable by any Managed Entity.

column.name: internal_name
column.remarks:
A candidate key useful for programmatic references to individual records.
**General Usage**
This column is system maintained and should be considered read only in normal operations.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks:
A friendly name and candidate key for the record, suitable for use in user interactions
**General Usage**

column.name: external_name
column.remarks: A non-unique/non-key value used to display to users and external parties where uniqueness is less of a concern than specific end user presentation.

column.name: place_type_id
column.remarks: Defines the kind of Place the record represents. Different types of Places may offer different functional abilities and limitations.

column.name: place_state_id
column.remarks: Establishes where in the record life-cycle that the record current sits.

column.name: diag_timestamp_created
column.remarks:

**General Usage**
